text: Bourg-en-Bresse is a commune in the Ain department, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region in east France. It is the prefecture of the department and the capital of the arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse. ==Geography== Bourg-en-Bresse is located at the western base of the Jura Mountains, on the left bank of the Reyssouze river, a tributary of the Saône. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Bourg-en-Bresse to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Lyon, the regional capital - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Strasbourg - ; * Nantes - ; * Marseille - . Bourg-en-Bresse and its neighboring communes The commune of Bourg-en-Bresse is surrounded by the communes Viriat, Jasseron, Saint-Just, Montagnat, Péronnas and Saint- Denis-lès-Bourg. ===Climate=== The climate of Bourg-en-Bresse, in the Köppen climate classification, is Cfb - Oceanic climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Bourg-en-Bresse are known, in French, as Burgiens (women: Burgiennes'). Bourg-en-Bresse has a population, in 2014, of 40,967 and its population density is of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Bourg-en-Bresse, formed by 69 communes, with a population of 125,863 inhabitants (2014) and an area of . ==Administration== Bourg-en-Bresse is the prefecture of the Ain department since 1800. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Bourg-en-Bresse and the administrative centre () of two cantons: * Bourg-en-Bresse-1 formed by one commune and part of Bourg-en-Bresse, with 31,801 inhabitants (2014). * Bourg-en-Bresse-2 formed by 3 communes and part of Bourg-en-Bresse, with 28,101 inhabitants (2014).
